titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the J. Walter Thompson Company. Anthony J. Viola Papers, 1968-2009 and undated RL.00757

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. Anthony J. Viola papers
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: The J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT), founded in 1864, is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. Anthony Viola worked as a Creative executive with a number of agencies before retiring as Senior Art Director with JWT. The Anthony J. Viola Papers span the years 1968-2009 and document Viola's career, especially his role as an art director at JWT's New York, Chicago, and Lisbon offices. The papers include some correspondence and other office files but the bulk of the collection consists of artwork for print advertisements and television storyboards; along with videocassettes, videotapes, DVDs and 16mm films of television commercials created by Viola. The papers cover JWT offices in Chicago; New York; Milan (Italy); Buenos Aires (Argentina); Lisbon (Portugal); and Santiago (Chile). Key clients include Bell Atlantic; the City of Boston; Citibank; Dole; Kodak; Interstate Bakeries; Johnson & Johnson; Kellogg; Kimberly Clark; Kraft Foods; Mars; Miller beer; Nestl√©; Pepsi; Pfizer; Reckitt & Benckiser; Rolex; Sears; Schlitz; Unilever; and Warner Lambert. Most of the files are in English; some materials are in Spanish. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: However, original audiovisual materials are closed to researchers until use copies can be made.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. Anthony J. Viola Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. Anthony J. Viola Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2009.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession 2009-0104 is described in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Anthony J. Viola Papers span the years 1968-2009 and document Viola's career, especially his role as an art director at JWT's New York, Chicago, and Lisbon offices. The papers include some correspondence and other office files but the bulk of the collection consists of artwork for print advertisements and television storyboards; along with videocassettes, videotapes, DVDs and 16mm films of television commercials created by Viola. The papers cover JWT offices in Chicago; New York; Milan (Italy); Buenos Aires (Argentina); Lisbon (Portugal); and Santiago (Chile). Key clients include Bell Atlantic; the City of Boston; Citibank; Dole; Kodak; Interstate Bakeries; Johnson & Johnson; Kellogg; Kimberly Clark; Kraft Foods; Mars; Miller beer; Nestl√©; Pepsi; Pfizer; Reckitt & Benckiser; Rolex; Sears; Schlitz; Unilever; and Warner Lambert. Most of the files are in English; some materials are in Spanish.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into three Series: General Records; Advertising Designs; and Audiovisual Materials.

The General Records series is organized into three categories: Office Files; Personal Files; and Use Copies of Audiovisual Materials. Office Files includes correspondence and memoranda for General Electric, and the JWT Milan (Italy) and Santiago (Chile) Offices. Personal Files contains private correspondence, resumes and biographical sketches. Use Copies of Audiovisual Materials contains use copies of Viola's television commercials and scans of sketches, print advertisements, TV boards and storyboards from the 1970s to 2000s. The Advertising Designs series contains the bulk of the collections' content. This series is divided into categories according to form and format: small- and large-format Artwork; small- and large-format Laminated Print Advertisements; Mounted Advertising Designs; and Oversized Materials. Arranged alphabetically by brand. Artwork contains mostly sketches, drafts and proofs of television commercial storyboards and print advertisements, as well as some attached notes. The Laminated Print Advertisements contains proofs of print advertisements, laminated for use in presentations. Mounted Advertising Designs consist of print advertisements and storyboards that have been mounted on mat board or foamcore board. Oversized Materials contains sketches, drafts and final proofs of television commercial storyboards, sketches and final proofs of print advertisements, as well as some screen prints and posters. The Audiovisual Series contains television commercials, presentation and sample reels in 16mm film, 1-inch videotape, VHS videocassette, Betacam, and DVD formats. Use copies are available for some of these commercials. Arranged alphabetically by brand or title.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections of the J. Walter Thompson Company Archives:
In addition, other advertising Art Directors' papers held by the Hartman Center include:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes corporate and private correspondence, memoranda, resumes and DVDs of television commercials along with scans of print advertisements. Firms represented include General Electric, and the JWT Milan (Italy) and Santiago (Chile) Offices. Organized into two categories: Office Files and Personal Files Arranged alphabetically.

accessrestrict.p: Restrictions on Access: Original audiovisual materials are closed to patrons until use copies can be made. Use copies exist for some items.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Contents include: 1970s: Underwood canned meats; B&M Baked Beans; Canal Bank; WSBK TV-38/Boston Red Sox; Mass Bay United Fund/United Way; Polaroid SX-70 camera; Better Home Heat Council; New England Merchants National Bank; Mayor's Older Bostonians; Jovan; Boston Bicentennial; Sears Thumb's Up Jeans; Schlitz]
[1980s: Oscar Mayer lunch meats; Kraft Mayonnaise; Nestea tea bags; Kodak (commercials in Portuguese, English and Spanish); Jake's Diet Cola; Pepsi (in Spanish)]
[1990s: Kellogg's Bran Flakes; Merita Lite Bread; Sunkist Children's Multivitamins; You yogurt drink (in Portuguese); Mimosa yogurt (in Portuguese); Sumol drink (in Portuguese); Listerine; Lubriderm]
